text: How do I send crypto from Coinbase?

metadata.response: To send crypto on Coinbase, go to the trading or funding section, select the currency, choose send, enter recipient address and amount, then confirm the on-chain transaction.

text: Why hasn’t my crypto been received?

metadata.response: If the recipient hasn’t received your crypto, check the transaction status in your Coinbase activity or blockchain explorer to ensure confirmation.

text: What is Binance Wallet?

metadata.response: Binance Wallet is a self-custody wallet integrated in the Binance app using MPC tech, enabling secure token swaps, yield, and dApp access.

text: How do I send and receive tokens using Binance Wallet?

metadata.response: Tap Send, choose asset and recipient address, enter amount, and confirm. For receiving, tap Receive, select via address or Binance Exchange, and share the QR code or address.

text: Why is my transaction pending on Binance Wallet?

metadata.response: Pending due to low gas fee. Use the speed-up function or increase fee to try early confirmation.

text: What is the Binance BTC transaction accelerator?

metadata.response: A service to speed up BTC confirmations when networks are congested or fees are low; it prioritizes you with miners.

text: Why does a crypto transaction take so long to confirm?

metadata.response: Confirmation time depends on network congestion and the fee you've attached; low fees or busy networks delay it.

text: Where can I find my transaction ID (TxID)?

metadata.response: Find TxID in your wallet or exchange under transaction history; it’s a unique hash you can use to track the transaction on a blockchain explorer.

text: How does Binance Convert Recurring work?

metadata.response: Binance Convert Recurring automates crypto purchases at regular intervals (hourly, daily, weekly, etc.) with zero fees using DCA strategy.

text: What happens if I don’t have enough balance for my recurring plan?

metadata.response: If balance’s insufficient, the purchase fails; it will retry next cycle. If it fails continuously for 6 months, the plan is canceled.

text: How many recurring plans can I have on Binance Convert?

metadata.response: You can subscribe to up to 20 recurring plans, including paused ones.

text: What are maker and taker fees on exchanges?

metadata.response: Makers add liquidity and pay lower fees; takers remove it and pay more. Fees vary based on trading volume tiers.

text: How do I send crypto from Coinbase?

metadata.response: On-chain send: go to Send/Receive, pick the cryptocurrency and on-chain option, enter recipient address and amount, then confirm.

text: Why hasn’t my crypto been received by the recipient?

metadata.response: Check the transaction status in your Coinbase activity or via a blockchain explorer to ensure it’s confirmed.

text: What is my available balance on Coinbase?

metadata.response: Your available balance is the amount you can send or cash out, which is total account value minus any funds on hold.

text: What is a destination tag or memo for Coinbase?

metadata.response: Certain cryptocurrencies require a Memo or Destination Tag—make sure to include it when sending or receiving to avoid loss of funds.

text: How do I deposit cryptocurrency on Binance?

metadata.response: Go to Deposit > Deposit Crypto, choose currency and network, copy the address or QR code, then send from your external wallet (ensure networks match).

text: Why hasn't my deposit been credited on Binance?

metadata.response: Check the blockchain explorer with your TxID. Deposits may be delayed by network congestion or missing memo/tag. Binance articles detail recovery steps.

text: How do I withdraw crypto using Bitcoin Lightning Network on Binance?

metadata.response: Select BTC and Lightning as network, paste the deposit invoice from the originating platform, enter matching amount, confirm with 2FA. Invoice expires in 30 minutes.

text: What is a liquidity pool?

metadata.response: A liquidity pool is a smart-contract-locked collection of crypto (usually two tokens) used to enable trading on decentralized exchanges without order books.

text: How do liquidity pools work and how do providers earn?

metadata.response: Providers deposit equal value tokens into a pool. An AMM sets prices using the constant product formula (x * y = k). Providers earn a share of trading fees and may receive LP tokens as proof of share.

text: What are the risks of liquidity pools?

metadata.response: Risks include impermanent loss, smart-contract vulnerabilities, and slippage, especially in low-liquidity pools.
metadata.source: TastyCrypto liquidity pools pros and cons

text: How can I deposit crypto into my CoinDCX account?

metadata.response: Log in, go to Funds → Deposit, choose crypto, copy wallet address or scan QR, pick correct network, send from external source.

text: How do I withdraw crypto from CoinDCX?

metadata.response: In app, go to Account → Crypto Transactions → Withdraw. Pick token, enter address/network, complete verification and get processed.

text: Can I deposit or withdraw crypto from any wallet or exchange?

metadata.response: Yes, if the wallet/exchange is verified and passes compliance. Restricted sources are blocked.

text: What are CoinDCX INR deposit and withdrawal charges?

metadata.response: INR deposits and withdrawals have no fees. KYC and BAV needed for access.

text: What are the withdrawal limits on CoinDCX?

metadata.response: Non-KYC users trade up to ₹10,000. Full KYC: min ₹1,000, max ₹500,000/day, 10 transactions/day, max ₹50,000 per transaction.
metadata.source: Republic World summary of CoinDCX limits

text: Why can’t I withdraw crypto from CoinDCX?

metadata.response: Crypto withdrawals are restricted pending regulatory clarity—even though INR deposit/withdraw are fine, crypto transfers are limited for retail users.
metadata.source: User reports on CoinDCX withdrawal restrictions

text: How do I make an on-chain crypto deposit to Bybit?

metadata.response: Transfer from external wallet via blockchain to your Bybit account. Only use supported coins/chains and include correct memo/tag if required.

text: Why can't I withdraw my funds from derivatives on Bybit?

metadata.response: Withdrawals are only possible from your Spot (Funding) account. Move funds from Derivatives or Earn to Spot first.

text: What are the withdrawal limits on Bybit?

metadata.response: Limits depend on your KYC and VIP level—range from 2 BTC to 100 BTC daily.

text: Why might my Bybit withdrawals be restricted for 24 hours?

metadata.response: Changing password, registered mobile, email, fund password, 2FA, or address withdrawal lock triggers a 24-hour withdrawal restriction.

text: What is decentralized finance (DeFi)?

metadata.response: DeFi is financial services on blockchain using smart contracts—lending, trading, borrowing—without banks or intermediaries.

text: How do DeFi transactions work?

metadata.response: DeFi transactions execute via smart contracts on blockchains—peer to peer, immutable, permissionless, no need for an intermediary.

text: What is staking in crypto?

metadata.response: Staking puts your crypto to work validating a blockchain (like PoS); in return you earn rewards for supporting network security.

text: What is DeFi staking?

metadata.response: DeFi staking locks your assets in smart contracts (non-custodial) to earn rewards; you keep control while contributing to protocol functions.

text: What is liquid staking?

metadata.response: Liquid staking lets you stake assets and receive tradable tokens (like stETH/rETH) that represent your stake and continue earning rewards.

text: What are the risks of DeFi staking?

metadata.response: Risks include smart contract bugs, impermanent loss, slashing penalties, and vulnerabilities in DeFi protocols.

text: Are liquid staking tokens securities?

metadata.response: The SEC clarified that liquid staking tokens are not securities, easing regulatory concerns for DeFi platforms.

text: What is protocol staking?

metadata.response: Protocol staking is staking crypto to help validate and secure a PoS blockchain, earning rewards in new tokens or transaction fees.

text: How does liquid staking enable restaking?

metadata.response: Restaking involves using liquid staking tokens to stake again in other protocols for additional rewards, expanding DeFi opportunities.
metadata.source: Academic framework on LSTs and restaking

text: How does Ethereum staking work?

metadata.response: Staking 32 ETH registers you as a validator. Validators propose/attest blocks and earn rewards but can be penalized if they act badly.

text: Why is my crypto transaction stuck or pending?

metadata.response: Transactions can get stuck due to network congestion, low fees, wallet sync issues, or smart contract errors.

text: What can I do if my transaction is stuck due to low fees?

metadata.response: Increase the fee (gas or miner fee), use wallet 'fast' settings, or wait for network congestion to ease.

text: How do I speed up or override a stuck Bitcoin transaction?

metadata.response: You can use Replace-By-Fee (RBF), Child Pays For Parent (CPFP), or transaction accelerators offered by mining pools.

text: Why might an exchange withdrawal be stuck?

metadata.response: Common reasons: incomplete KYC, amount under minimum, policy violations, wallet maintenance, exceeded limits, wrong address, network congestion, or trusted-address protection.

text: How long do stuck transactions stay pending?

metadata.response: It varies—weeks in some cases. Transactions may eventually expire and return to your wallet if they remain unconfirmed.

text: How do I “speed up” a stuck MetaMask transaction?

metadata.response: Use MetaMask’s 'speed up' feature to resend with a higher gas price, or 'reset account' to clear stuck history without losing funds.

text: Can sending 0 ETH with same nonce cancel a stuck Ethereum transaction?

metadata.response: Yes. Sending to yourself 0 ETH with the same nonce and higher gas can override the stuck transaction.

text: What do Redditors suggest for a stuck polygon transaction?

metadata.response: Enable custom nonce, get the stuck transaction’s nonce from explorer, then send 0 MATIC to yourself with same nonce.

text: What if a transaction seems stuck in the mempool too long?

metadata.response: If fees are too low, transactions can remain in the mempool indefinitely. Most wallets will return funds after expiry; you’ll have to resend at a higher fee.

text: Which blockchain networks have near-zero or no transaction fees?

metadata.response: Nano offers feeless, near-instant transactions via a block-lattice structure. IOTA uses a DAG (Tangle) to enable feeless transfers.

text: Why are Nano and IOTA feeless?

metadata.response: Nano avoids miners by giving each account its own blockchain and uses delegated PoS voting; IOTA’s DAG lets each new transaction approve two others—no miner fees needed.

text: What are the cheapest blockchain networks currently?

metadata.response: Solana (~$0.00025), Algorand (~0.001 ALGO), Stellar (~$0.00001 XLM), Bitgert (near-zero), plus Layer-2s like Base (~$0.001) and Arbitrum (~$0.03).

text: How cheap are Ethereum Layer-2 networks like Base and Arbitrum?

metadata.response: Base charges around $0.001 per transaction using Optimistic Rollups; Arbitrum’s fee is about $0.03, both much cheaper than Ethereum mainnet.
metadata.source: ValueWalk article on Base and Arbitrum

text: What about other cheap EVM-compatible chains?

metadata.response: BNB Chain users pay just a few cents (around $0.10–$0.50), Polygon less than $0.01, Avalanche $0.10–$0.50, and Solana around $0.00025.

text: Any networks designed especially for low gas use, like for payments?

metadata.response: Stellar excels in cross-border payments with fees around $0.00001. Harmony and Near are also cheap Layer-1 options, with Harmony ~0.0001–0.002 USD per tx.

text: Are there gasless solutions using meta-transactions or relayers?

metadata.response: Yes—Kinetex offers gasless swaps using relayers and gas escrow; Coinbase Wallet enables gas-free USDC transfers on Polygon via EIP-4337 account abstraction.
metadata.source: Kinetex docs & Reddit discussion on gas-free USDC

text: Can some platforms sponsor or pay gas for users?

metadata.response: Arcana Network sponsors gas fees for users to improve dApp usability, so interactions feel gasless from the user's perspective.
metadata.source: Reddit discussion on Arcana Network gasless feature
